results.title: Photographic design
results.brief_description: Host Brian Ratty explains and illustrates many tips about photographic design. He covers selecting the right tools, visualizing the best composition, and designing with light and colour.

results.title: Photographers of Australia: Dupain, Sievers, Moore
results.creator_credit: Gregory Read, Wolfgang Knochell and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Since the arrival of the camera in Australia in the mid 19th Century, it has recorded the nation’s life. This is the story of some of the most enduring images of the Australian experience and the three men who made them - Max Dupain, Wolfgang Sievers and David Moore. Relive the history of Australia, from the 1930s to the present day through the lenses of these renowned photographers.

results.title: Philippines No Choice but Change
results.brief_description: This film looks at the events, issues and opposition movement behind the fall of the Marcos dictatorship through the eyes of its participants including Cory Aquino, nuns, priests, lawyers, workers, farmers and guerilla fighters. Filmed all over the country, it shows why millions of Filipinos were swept into the fight for freedom.

results.title: Philadelphia
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Demme, Edward Saxon and Clinica Estetico
results.brief_description: In this emotionally-charged film about prejudices and human frailty, Tom Hanks stars as Andrew Beckett, a brilliant young lawyer battling AIDS, who is suddenly fired by his prestigious firm. Fighting for both his life and his professional reputation, Beckett hires street-wise personal injury attorney, Joe Miller (Denzel Washington in a power-house performance), to represent him as he sues the firm for wrongful termination. Seperated from Beckett by a deep social and cultural chasm, Miller has to challenge his own prejudices and fears if he is to take on the system and win. Honoured with an Academy Award for his brilliant performance, Tom Hanks leads a strong cast which includes Jason Robards, Mary Steenburgen and Antonio Banderas as Hank’s lover.

results.title: Phantom of the Opera
results.creator_credit: Jean Mathieson, Al Guest and Emerald City Productions
results.brief_description: In the eaves, the tunnels, the trap doors and the back stairs of the Paris Opera House a menacing figure watches. Captivated by the beautiful diva, Christine, the Phantom of the Opera is trapped by his hideous appearance hidden behind his cloak and mask. A beautifully animated adaptation of the ageless classic tale for children of all ages.

results.title: Philharmonic safari: the London Philharmonic Orchestra "down under"
results.creator_credit: Don Shepherd and Shepherd Baker Studios
results.brief_description: A magical documentary where the story is told through the combination of stunning images, beautiful sounds of orchestral music, and minimal commentary. It is a contrast of seasons and of cultures - winter in London, summer in Australia. This is a musical journey that takes you half-way around the globe with one of the world’s greatest orchestras, the London Philharmonic Orchestra. The story begins in a snow-covered wintery London with a performance by the London Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Klaus Tennstedt, at the Royal Festival Hall. Next, the orchestra boards a Qantas flight bound for Perth and their final destination, the magnificent Leeuwin Estate, a vineyard 250 kilometres south of Perth. It is here under the Australian night sky that the London Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Avi Ostrowski, will perform to an audience of around 4,500 enthusiastic and appreciative music lovers.

results.title: Phantom from 10,000 leagues
results.creator_credit: Dan Warner, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Curious title, considering the phantom rarely lurks deeper than six feet or so underwater. Kent Taylor and Rodney Bell are investigating several mysterious underwater deaths, supposedly caused by a sea “phantom.” The pair suspect that a professor of oceanography (Michael Whalen) knows something about the phantom, which he most certainly does. The phantom, a mutated sea monster, is the result of the professor’s evil experiments with an “atomic ray.” Both villain and phantom (which looks like an ulcerated beach toy) are dispatched by a few sticks of TNT. Famous for winning a ‘Golden Turkey’ award.

results.title: Philby, Burgess & Maclean
results.creator_credit: Gordon Flemyng, Jeremy Wallington and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: During the 1950’s the world was shocked by the defection to the Soviet Union of Guy Burgess and Donald Maclean, highly placed officials in the diplomatic service. Years later with the web slowly closing around him, Kim Philby defected also. Although in line for the Number Two job in the British Secret Service, he was also a full colonel in the KGB, whom he had secretly served throughout his career. This excellent dramatisation recreates the factual evidence which stunned a nation

results.title: Peter Ustinov reads the orchestra
results.creator_credit: Mark Rubin and Mark Rubin Productions
results.brief_description: This video version of the award-winning recording and book featuring The Toronto Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Walter Babiak, is a highly engaging way to introduce children to classical music and the instruments of the orchestra. It explains the process of composition and the basic musical concepts of melody, harmony, rhythm, tempo, dynamics and tone colour. It then describes the four main families of orchestral instruments and each of their individual members. It concludes with the role of the conductor, bringing music and musicians together in a grand concert finale. There are excerpts from 22 of the great classics, such as Tchaikovsky’s Nutcracker Suite and Beethoven’s Piano Concerto No. 5. Peter Ustinov’s narration, bursting with warmth and humour, and Alan Daniel’s colourful drawings of the musicians and their instruments make “The Orchestra” thoroughly entertaining and informative viewing.
